channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The New Medicine Tariffs Are a Prescription for Disaster
item.description: They’ll make Americans sicker, poorer, and less innovative.

item.title: Trump’s cartel crackdown gains ‘powerful political leverage’ with El Mayo guilty plea
item.description: Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada, Sinaloa Cartel co-founder, pleads guilty to drug trafficking charges and must forfeit $15 billion as Trump administration in...

item.title: Big Trump tariffs on India take effect, walloping a major Asian economy
item.description: President Trump's additional tariffs on India took effect Wednesday, bringing the total levy on imports from the Indo-Pacific ally to a whopping 50%.

item.title: Book authors hail ‘historic settlement’ as Anthropic dodges trial on how it actually acquired millions of copyrighted works to ingest
item.description: A judge ruled in June that Anthropic didn’t break the law by training its chatbot on copyrighted books, but it was still facing trial over how it acqu...

item.title: The NAACP Cracks Its Own Code
item.description: A soap opera skeleton key to black Democrat fealty.

item.title: Some FEMA staffers put on administrative leave after signing dissent letter
item.description: Some employees of the Federal Emergency Management Agency who signed a public letter of dissent earlier this week were put on administrative leave Tue...

item.title: Firing Lisa Cook
item.description: Can Trump fire her? The question does not admit of an easy answer.

item.title: Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev says investing for a living could replace labor in a post-AI world
item.description: "If you can't rely on labor to generate money to make a living, capital becomes more important," Tenev told Fortune.

item.title: Restoring Arlington Cemetery’s Reconciliation Monument Is Pivotal For American Greatness
item.description: The restoration of a monument in Arlington Cemetery may serve as the spiritual portal that brings America back to its origin in greatness.

item.title: Republicans discover socialism isn’t so bad when they do it, with Trump vowing more deals like Intel to come
item.description: Retiring Sen. Thom Tillis ripped his colleagues for their silence: “You’re going to have to explain to me how this reconciles with true conservatism a...

item.title: Social Security Is No Longer the Third Rail of American Politics
item.description: It’s proximate cause for a shotgun wedding.

item.title: Apple expected to roll out texting update that would hit GOP hardest ahead of midterms, fundraisers say
item.description: Apple's September iOS 26 update is expected to introduce text message filtering that GOP digital strategists claim could disproportionately affect con...

item.title: Cook’s potential exit hands Trump greater sway over Fed board shaping US monetary policy
item.description: Lisa Cook's potential removal from the Federal Reserve Board of Governors gives Trump another opportunity to name someone more closely aligned with hi...

item.title: Exclusive: UConn Hit With Civil Rights Complaint Over Anti-White Medical Program
item.description: Programs like UConn's are focused on developing racial quotas in the medical field, as opposed to training the best doctors who will be responsible fo...

item.title: Civil War Is Coming To Britain
item.description: Britain’s political leaders have lost all legitimacy, and the British people have the right to revolt against them in self-defense.

item.title: Wisconsin Judge Will Stand Trial On Charges Of Helping Illegal Alien Flee From ICE
item.description: Even a far-left federal judge isn't buying Milwaukee County Judge Hannah Dugan's claim she’s immune from criminal prosecution.

item.title: NAACP accuses Texas of 'racially motivated' redistricting move in new lawsuit
item.description: Texas faces a lawsuit from the NAACP alleging the state's redistricting map discriminates against Black communities and reduces their representation.

item.title: Denmark summons top U.S. diplomat over suspected Greenland influence ring
item.description: Denmark's foreign minister has summoned the chief U.S. diplomat in Copenhagen over reports that several American citizens were conducting an influence...

item.description: The 37-year-old housing industry scion has also accused Sen. Adam Schiff and New York AG Letitia James of mortgage fraud, and he's attacked Jerome Pow...

item.title: The Cure for Racial Discrimination in Medical Education
item.description: If colleges and universities want the American taxpayer’s support, they should be forced to focus on merit alone.

item.title: Katy Perry’s latest real-estate courtroom circus has pregnancy mix-ups, Trudeau gossip, and an 85-year-old foe
item.description: Perry previously battled nuns who tried to unwind their convent sale. Now it's an 85-year-old who claims he wasn't mentally competent to make a deal.

item.title: Transportation Department to run Union Station, improve commercial prospects
item.description: The Trump administration on Wednesday said it plans to take managerial control of Union Station to unlock the historic station's commercial potential.

item.title: Abrego Garcia renews push for asylum in US, reveals new country willing to accept him
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the Salvadoran man at the center of ongoing controversy and legal wranglings, is seeking asylum in the United States.

item.title: Colorado’s Zoning Tyrants Go To War Against A Christian-Owned French Bakery
item.description: Is it truly in the county’s best interest to destroy a thriving business and a cherished community hub simply to enforce its zoning ordinance?

item.description: From tokenized FX trades to stablecoin transfers, blockchain’s shift from pilot to practice is changing how capital moves across borders. The post Blo...
